contentrichtext.text: '''Rashtriya Janata Dal (Democratic)''' (National People's Party (Democratic)), [[political party]] in [[India]], formed when a group of five MPs (three [[Lok Sabha]], two [[Rajya Sabha]]) broke away from [[Rashtriya Janata Dal]] 2001.<ref name="frontline1">{{cite news |url=http://www.hinduonnet.com/fline/fl1810/18100390.htm |title=Fissures in the RJD |last=Chaudhuri |first=Kaylan |date=2001-05-12 |work=Frontline, India's national magazine |publisher=[[The Hindu]]|accessdate=2009-06-07}}</ref> RJD(D) joined [[National Democratic Alliance (India)|National Democratic Alliance]] and RJD(D) leader Nagmani became a minister in the government of [[Atal Bihari Vajpayee]] 2003. Later the same year RJD(D) merged with the [[Bharatiya Janata Party]]. == References == {{Reflist}} [[Category:Political parties in Bihar]] [[Category:Bharatiya Janata Party]] [[Category:Defunct political parties in India]]
